values: Convoy Leaders will give ramp brief prior to movement. Vehicle Crews will wear all required PPE while operating tactical vehicles. Vehicles will follow range roads and use ground guides in parking areas.
Ramp Brief, Proper PPE, Ground Guides, Follow Roads
Vehicle Crews, Convoy Leaders, PLT Leadership

Vehicle Crews will place snow chains on their vehicles if road conditions deteriorate. Additionally, Vehicle Crews will drive at reduced speed limits to and from the Range. These actions will be conducted on order from Convoy Leaders.
Convoy Leaders will review weather data and make decisions based on the ground conditions.
Convoy Leaders, Vehicle Crews, Training Leadership
Soliders will wear approved ballistic eye wear while conducting STX Lanes to prevent any injuries to soldiers eyes.
PCC/PCI, Enforcement of PPE wearing
PLT Leadership
Training will cease in the event of severe weather. GTA range operations desk will be called if the weather is put into question.
Safety Brief
PLT Leadership and SMs
Service Members will be briefed not to interact with local wildlife. Medic will attend to any injuries from local wildlife/insects.
Safety Brief
PLT Leadership and SMs
Service Members will pack adequate Cold Weather gear for Training, in accordance with the published packing list. Strykers will be available for service members to warm up in as needed/.
Packing List, PCCs/PCIs, Use of Strykers for Heat
Platoon Leadership, and Vehicle Crews
Platoon leadership will inspect for hearing protection, to ensure Troopers have standard issue protection or they will be provided hearing protection prior to firing b weapon.
PCCs/PCIs, Extra Hearing Protection available on site,
Platoon Leadership
